xxl.applications.pipes.traffic
Class HighwaySource

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.queryGraph.AbstractNode
      xxl.core.pipes.sources.AbstractSource
          xxl.applications.pipes.traffic.HighwaySource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node, Source, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
public class HighwaySource
extends AbstractSource

This class simulates a sensor from a highway ( see http://www.clearingstelle-verkehr.de/cs/verkehrsdaten/katalog/katalogberichte/fsp/fsp_metadaten) It is initialised and provided from the class SourceFilesToSource. Usage examples are in Highway.

Constant Field Values

SKIP_TIME

public static final long SKIP_TIME
If a time difference is greater than this value, it will be ignored, for example 1 hour 1 minute --> 0 ms

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ids

protected int[] ids
An array, containing ids that will be used in the transfer method.

files

protected RandomAccessFile[] files
An array, containing files that will be used to deliver tuples.

times

protected long[] times
This array contains a timestamp from every source. the source with the lowest value will deliver the next tuple.

tokenizer

protected StringTokenizer[] tokenizer
Tokenizer[i] contains a line of files[i].

FileTokenizer is used to decompose the filenames.

The minimal entry in the 'times' array.

The source, that has currently the minimal entry in the times array.

A flag, signing the new values for timeMinimum has been computed.

difference

protected long difference
This long is needed to adapt the time values.

factor

protected float factor
A factor to speed up or slow down the original tupel rate. for instance 0,5 will increase the speed by 100%, 2 decrease the speed to 50% of the original rate.

Constructor Detail

HighwaySource

public HighwaySource(String[] fileNames,
                     float factor)
Creates a new HighwaySource instance. The arguments are used to determine, what files are needed and what lane number belongs to a file.

Parameters:
fileNames - all filenames for this source.
factor - a factor to speed up or slow down the original tupel rate. For instance 0,5 will increase the speed by 100%, 2 decrease the speed to 50% of the original rate.

HighwaySource

public HighwaySource(String[] fileNames)
Creates a new HighwaySource instance. the arguments are used to determine, what files are needed and what lane number belongs to a file.

Parameters:
fileNames - all filenames for this source.
Method Detail

nextSleepTime

public long nextSleepTime()
Computes the minimal time from all times in the currently used line of each file in "files". It is used in an iterator for the sleep time of the sourceprocessor of this source.

Returns:
int the next sleep time.

next

public Object next()
            throws NoSuchElementException
Computes the next object, that will be passed to the transfer method.

Specified by:
next in class AbstractSource
Returns:
Object the next object, that will be passed to the transfer method.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if all tuples have been passed.

synchronizeTime

public void synchronizeTime(long difference)

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Executes an example if the right arguments are passed.

Parameters:
args - containing the following information:
args[0] = path to inputfileName.
It is assumed, that the highway files have beeen created. A lot of tests are in 'xxl.applications.pipes.Tests' (method: highwayTest)
